intro: Quararibea tulekunae, commonly known as the Tulekuna mahogany, is a small evergreen tree native to the rainforests of northern South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary growth and disturbed areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
